abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Small Enterprise APEX Project in
            Burundi. Overall, the project's achievements fell short
            of expectations. This is not surprising given the political
            turmoil that plagued the country during project
            implementation. There are four important lessons that emerge
            from the implementation of this project: (a) The design of
            lines of credit to commercial banks, which more often than
            not, lack the institutional capacity to manage the
            complexities of such an operation, should be as simple as
            possible avoiding excessive layers of review and approval.
            (b) In a complex project such as this one, the technical and
            regulatory/supervisory capacity of the APEX agency, in this
            case Central Bank of the Republic of Burundi (BRB), is a
            critical determinant of project success. (c) It is important
            to find appropriate channels to provide technical assistance
            to entrepreneurs in project management, marketing and basic
            accounting, to help them run their business profitably. (d)
            Future lines of credit should incorporate arrangements for
            acceptable standards of project management and accounting.
            Furthermore, the responsibility for promoting and managing
            the line of credit should be separate from operations of the
            Central Bank because of the inherent difference in these
            activities. Finally, the Project should have had a special
            account to ensure availability of funds during the
            implementation period.

docna.cdata!:
Burundi - Small Enterprise-Apex Project :
            Credit 1889 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Burundi - Small Enterprise-Apex
            Project : Credit 1889 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
The Small Enterprise APEX Project
            involves an IDA credit to the Government of Burundi of
            US$8.0 million. It includes (i) an investment component of
            US$7.2 million equivalent to finance development projects
            promoted by SSEs; and (ii) a technical assistance and
            training component of US$0.8 million. This last component
            aims to (a) help small entrepreneurs to prepare and manage
            their projects and (b) strengthen the participating
            financial intermediaries' capacity to appraise and
            supervise investment projects. The project will help nurture
            SSE development which is expected to generate new job
            opportunities at a relatively low capital cost. It is
            expected that the credit component will help create 2500 new
            jobs at an average cost of US$4000 per job.
